decision_conditions: The proposed development would result in living conditions that do not create a suitably high quality living environment for future occupiers. The constraints and cramped layout of the proposed dwellings will be to the detriment of the amenity of future occupiers. The proposed dwellings fail to meet the minimum requirements of the Nationally Described Space Standards and fail to provide adequate private amenity spaces for both flats. The privacy of the ground floor residents will be compromised by the siting of the proposed communal bin and bicycle storage. The quality of the living conditions would be substandard and give rise to an overwhelming sense of enclosure in direct contrast to the aims of London Plan Policy 3.5 and Policy DC61 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent in writing on 28/11/19.
description: Conversion of existing terraced house into 2 x 1 bed self-contained flats
